issue.title: Tasks to prepare for the lesson
issue.body:
- [ ] step by step heroku guide
- [ ] example express app.js for the recap session
  - [ ] materials to dig into req.params, req.query
  - [ ] middleware example
- [ ] github client with getUserProfile route
- [ ] empty controllers/cv.js file (?)
- [ ] readme
- [ ] tests

comment.body:
I'm working to this lesson plan:

Tasks

API client
 - complete the fetchFromGithub function so that the getUserProfile test passes
 - /users/{username}/events/public is a github endpoint that returns all a user's activity on github. Use this to retrieve a list of a user's pull requests 
 by adding a `getUserPullRequests` method. The getUserPullRequests test should pass

Controllers
 - set up a cv controller that outputs your existing html cv, using handlebars templates
 - within this controller fetch your github user profile 
 - *extension task* - use `?format=json` to send a json only response
 - *extension task* - set up a user controller to send the same information, minus your CV, for any user. Try to minimise how much you copy and paste code - can some of the code you wrote be extracted into another shared module in your `/lib` directory

Middleware
 - add error handling middleware to send a 404 response if a user is not found, or a 503 error if anything else goes wrong

issue.title: Remove webpack from node dependencies
issue.body:
To test this, I ran `make clean install build` and  `make clean install build-production` for both the `master` and the `remove-webpack` branch.

After each build, I moved the `/public/` directory into another folder.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/224547/23066150/005716d0-f511-11e6-8fbd-1056be32c29f.png)

Above: For both `build` and `build-production`, the generated `/public/` content is identical. Except for timestamps in `__about.json`.

comment.body: actually, you probably still need bower in your dependencies
